pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.4_0: The second training rule on acknowledgment
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.12_0: “... Foolish men, how can you not do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.14_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.15.1_0: ‘When monks eat at invitations to families, if a nun is there giving directions, saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice here,” then those monks should stop her: “Stop, Sister, while the monks are eating.” If not even a single monk addresses that nun in this way to stop her, they must acknowledge it:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.15.1_1: if a monk doesn’t have to rebuke that nun, saying,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.16_0: “We have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing which is to be acknowledged. We acknowledge it.”’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.2_0: At that time, when families invited monks to meals,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.3_0: the nuns from the group of six were directing people toward the monks from the group of six, saying,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.5_0: The monks from the group of six ate as much as they wanted,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.6_0: but not so the other monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.8_0: “How can the monks from the group of six not restrain the nuns from giving directions?” ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that you didn’t do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.12_0: the nun who is giving directions.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.13_0: Those monks should stop her: ‘Stop, Sister, while the monks are eating’:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.14_0: if she is not stopped by even one monk, and a monk then receives food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.15_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.1_0: When monks eat at invitations to families:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.2_0: a family: there are four kinds of family: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.4_0: invited to eat any of the five staple foods.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.8_0: saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice here,” according to friendship, according to companionship, according to whom one is devoted to, according to being a co-student, according to being a co-pupil—this is called “giving directions”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.1_0: If she is fully ordained, and he perceives her as such, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.2_0: If she is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.3_0: If she is fully ordained, but he does not perceive her as such, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.4_0: If he does not restrain a nun who is fully ordained only on one side from giving directions, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.5_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.6_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.7_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.12_0: The second training rule on acknowledgment is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.2_0: if a nun has someone else give her own food, but she does not get anyone to give it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.3_0: if a nun gives someone else’s food, but she does not get anyone to give it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.4_0: if a nun gets someone to give what has not yet been given;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.5_0: if a nun gets someone to give to someone who has not yet received anything;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.6_0: if a nun gets someone to give equally to all;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.7_0: if a trainee nun is giving directions;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.8_0: if a novice nun is giving directions;
